verses.verse: I say <S%G2046><s%> then, <S%G3767><s%> Has God <S%G2316><s%> cast <S%G683><s%> away <S%G683><s%> his people? <S%G2992><s%> God <S%G3361><s%> <S%G1096><s%> forbid. <S%G3361><s%> <S%G1096><s%> For I also <S%G2532><s%> am <S%G1510><s%> an Israelite, <S%G2475><s%> of the seed <S%G4690><s%> of Abraham, <S%G11><s%> of the tribe <S%G5443><s%> of Benjamin. <S%G958><s%>

God <S%G2316><s%> has not cast <S%G683><s%> away <S%G683><s%> his people <S%G2992><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> he foreknew. <S%G4267><s%> Know <S%G1492><s%> you not what <S%G5101><s%> the scripture <S%G1124><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> of Elias? <S%G2243><s%> how <S%G5613><s%> he makes <S%G1793><s%> intercession <S%G1793><s%> to God <S%G2316><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> Israel <S%G2474><s%>saying, <S%G3004><s%>

But what <S%G5101><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> the answer <S%G5538><s%> of God to him? I have reserved <S%G2641><s%> to myself <S%G1683><s%> seven <S%G2035><s%> thousand <S%G2035><s%> men, <S%G435><s%> who <S%G3748><s%> have not bowed <S%G2578><s%> the knee <S%G1119><s%> to the image of Baal. <S%G896><s%>

Even <S%G2532><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> then <S%G3767><s%> at <S%G1722><s%> this <S%G3588><s%> present <S%G3568><s%> time <S%G2540><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> there is a remnant <S%G3005><s%> according <S%G2596><s%> to the election <S%G1589><s%> of grace. <S%G5485><s%>

What <S%G5101><s%> then? <S%G3767><s%> Israel <S%G2474><s%> has not obtained <S%G2013><s%> that which <S%G3739><s%> he seeks <S%G1934><s%> for; but the election <S%G1589><s%> has obtained <S%G2013><s%> it, and the rest <S%G3062><s%> were blinded. <S%G4456><s%>

(According <S%G2531><s%> as it is written, <S%G1125><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> has given <S%G1325><s%> them the spirit <S%G4151><s%> of slumber, <S%G2659><s%> eyes <S%G3788><s%> that they should not see, <S%G991><s%> and ears <S%G3775><s%> that they should not hear; <S%G191><s%>) to this <S%G4594><s%> day. <S%G2250><s%>

And David <S%G1138><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> Let their table <S%G5132><s%> be made <S%G1096><s%> a snare, <S%G3803><s%> and a trap, <S%G2339><s%> and a stumbling block, <S%G4625><s%> and a recompense <S%G468><s%> to them:
Let their eyes <S%G3788><s%> be darkened, <S%G4654><s%> that they may not see, <S%G991><s%> and bow <S%G4781><s%> down <S%G4781><s%> their back <S%G3577><s%> always. <S%G1275><s%>

I say <S%G2046><s%> then, <S%G3767><s%> Have they stumbled <S%G4417><s%> that they should fall? <S%G4098><s%> God <S%G3361><s%> <S%G1096><s%> forbid: <S%G3361><s%> <S%G1096><s%> but rather through their fall <S%G3900><s%> salvation <S%G4991><s%> is come to the Gentiles, <S%G1484><s%> for to provoke <S%G3863><s%> them to jealousy.

Now <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> the fall <S%G3900><s%> of them be the riches <S%G4149><s%> of the world, <S%G2889><s%> and the diminishing <S%G2275><s%> of them the riches <S%G4149><s%> of the Gentiles; <S%G1484><s%> how <S%G4214><s%> much <S%G4214><s%> more <S%G3123><s%> their fullness? <S%G4138><s%>

For I speak <S%G3004><s%> to you Gentiles, <S%G1484><s%> inasmuch <S%G1909><s%> <S%G3745><s%> as I am <S%G1510><s%> the apostle <S%G652><s%> of the Gentiles, <S%G1484><s%> I magnify <S%G1392><s%> my <S%G3450><s%> office: <S%G1248><s%>

If <S%G1513><s%> by any <S%G4458><s%> means <S%G4458><s%> I may provoke <S%G3863><s%> to emulation <S%G3863><s%> them which are my flesh, <S%G4561><s%> and might save <S%G4982><s%> some <S%G5100><s%> of them.

For if <S%G1487><s%> the casting <S%G580><s%> away <S%G580><s%> of them be the reconciling <S%G2643><s%> of the world, <S%G2889><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> shall the receiving <S%G4356><s%> of them be, but life <S%G2222><s%> from the dead? <S%G3498><s%>

For if <S%G1487><s%> the first fruit <S%G536><s%> be holy, <S%G40><s%> the lump <S%G5445><s%> is also <S%G2532><s%> holy: <S%G40><s%> and if <S%G1487><s%> the root <S%G4491><s%> be holy, <S%G40><s%> so <S%G2532><s%> are the branches. <S%G2798><s%>

And if <S%G1487><s%> some <S%G5100><s%> of the branches <S%G2798><s%> be broken <S%G1575><s%> off, <S%G1575><s%> and you, being <S%G5607><s%> a wild <S%G65><s%> olive <S%G65><s%> tree, <S%G65><s%> were grafted <S%G1461><s%> in among <S%G1722><s%> them, and with them partake <S%G1096><s%> <S%G4791><s%> of the root <S%G4491><s%> and fatness <S%G4096><s%> of the olive <S%G1636><s%> tree;
Boast <S%G2620><s%> not against <S%G2620><s%> the branches. <S%G2798><s%> But if <S%G1487><s%> you boast, you bore <S%G941><s%> not the root, <S%G4491><s%> but the root <S%G4491><s%> you.
You will say <S%G2046><s%> then, <S%G3767><s%> The branches <S%G2798><s%> were broken <S%G1575><s%> off, <S%G1575><s%> that I might be grafted <S%G1461><s%> in.

Well; <S%G2573><s%> because of unbelief <S%G570><s%> they were broken <S%G1575><s%> off, <S%G1575><s%> and you stand <S%G2476><s%> by faith. <S%G4102><s%> Be not high minded, <S%G5309><s%> but fear: <S%G5399><s%>

For if <S%G1487><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> spared <S%G5339><s%> not the natural <S%G2596><s%> <S%G5449><s%> branches, <S%G2798><s%> take heed <S%G3708><s%> lest <S%G3381><s%> he also <S%G3761><s%> spare <S%G5339><s%> not you.

Behold <S%G1492><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> the goodness <S%G5544><s%> and severity <S%G663><s%> of God: <S%G2316><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> them which fell, <S%G4098><s%> severity; <S%G663><s%> but toward <S%G1909><s%> you, goodness, <S%G5544><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> you continue <S%G1961><s%> in his goodness: <S%G5544><s%> otherwise <S%G1893><s%> you also <S%G2532><s%> shall be cut <S%G1581><s%> off. <S%G1581><s%>

And they also, <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> they abide <S%G1961><s%> not still in unbelief, <S%G570><s%> shall be grafted <S%G1461><s%> in: for God <S%G2316><s%> is able <S%G1415><s%> to graft <S%G1461><s%> them in again. <S%G3825><s%>

For if <S%G1487><s%> you were cut <S%G1581><s%> out of the olive <S%G65><s%> tree <S%G65><s%> which is wild <S%G65><s%> by nature, <S%G5449><s%> and were grafted <S%G1461><s%> contrary <S%G3844><s%> to nature <S%G5449><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> a good <S%G2565><s%> olive <S%G2565><s%> tree: <S%G2565><s%> how <S%G4214><s%> much <S%G4214><s%> more <S%G3123><s%> shall these, <S%G3778><s%> which be the natural <S%G2596><s%> <S%G5449><s%> branches, <S%G2798><s%> be grafted <S%G1461><s%> into their own <S%G2398><s%> olive <S%G1636><s%> tree?

For I would <S%G2309><s%> not, brothers, <S%G80><s%> that you should be ignorant <S%G50><s%> of this <S%G5124><s%> mystery, <S%G3466><s%> lest <S%G2443><s%> <S%G3361><s%> you should be wise <S%G5429><s%> in your <S%G3844><s%> <S%G1438><s%> own <S%G1438><s%> conceits; <S%G3844><s%> <S%G1438><s%> that blindness <S%G4457><s%> in part <S%G3313><s%> is happened <S%G1096><s%> to Israel, <S%G2474><s%> until <S%G891><s%> the fullness <S%G4138><s%> of the Gentiles <S%G1484><s%> be come <S%G1525><s%> in.

And so <S%G3779><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> Israel <S%G2474><s%> shall be saved: <S%G4982><s%> as it is written, <S%G1125><s%> There shall come <S%G2240><s%> out of Sion <S%G4622><s%> the Deliverer, <S%G4506><s%> and shall turn <S%G654><s%> away <S%G654><s%> ungodliness <S%G763><s%> from Jacob: <S%G2384><s%>
For this <S%G3778><s%> is my covenant <S%G1242><s%> to them, when <S%G3752><s%> I shall take <S%G851><s%> away <S%G851><s%> their sins. <S%G266><s%>

As concerning <S%G2596><s%> the gospel, <S%G2098><s%> they are enemies <S%G2190><s%> for your <S%G5209><s%> sakes: but as touching <S%G2596><s%> the election, <S%G1589><s%> they are beloved <S%G27><s%> for the father's <S%G3962><s%> sakes.
For the gifts <S%G5486><s%> and calling <S%G2821><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> are without <S%G278><s%> repentance. <S%G278><s%>
For as you in times <S%G4218><s%> past have not believed <S%G544><s%> God, <S%G2316><s%> yet have now <S%G3568><s%> obtained <S%G1653><s%> mercy <S%G1653><s%> through their unbelief: <S%G543><s%>

Even so <S%G3779><s%> have these <S%G3778><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> now <S%G3568><s%> not believed, <S%G544><s%> that through your <S%G5212><s%> mercy <S%G1656><s%> they also <S%G2532><s%> may obtain <S%G1653><s%> mercy. <S%G1653><s%>
For God <S%G2316><s%> has concluded <S%G4788><s%> them all <S%G3956><s%> in unbelief, <S%G543><s%> that he might have mercy <S%G1653><s%> on all. <S%G3956><s%>

O the depth <S%G899><s%> of the riches <S%G4149><s%> both <S%G2532><s%> of the wisdom <S%G4678><s%> and knowledge <S%G1108><s%> of God! <S%G2316><s%> how <S%G5613><s%> unsearchable <S%G419><s%> are his judgments, <S%G2917><s%> and his ways <S%G3598><s%> past <S%G421><s%> finding <S%G421><s%> out!
For who <S%G5101><s%> has known <S%G1097><s%> the mind <S%G3563><s%> of the Lord? <S%G2962><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> who <S%G5101><s%> has been <S%G1096><s%> his counselor? <S%G4825><s%>
Or <S%G2228><s%> who <S%G5101><s%> has first <S%G4272><s%> given <S%G4272><s%> to him, and it shall be recompensed <S%G467><s%> to him again? <S%G467><s%>
For of him, and through <S%G1223><s%> him, and to him, are all <S%G3956><s%> things: to whom <S%G846><s%> be glory <S%G1391><s%> for ever. <S%G165><s%> Amen. <S%G281><s%>
